app_metadata.description: Open WebUI is an extensible, feature-rich, and user-friendly self-hosted WebUI designed to operate entirely offline. It supports various LLM runners, including Ollama and OpenAI-compatible APIs.
app_metadata.name: open-webui

run_as_context.description: Open WebUI runs as root user.
Redis runs as any non-root user.

app_metadata.title: Open WebUI

groups.name: User and Group Configuration
groups.description: Configure User and Group for Open WebUI

attrs.label: Image Selector
attrs.description:
Choose the image version for Open WebUI to run.</br>
Ollama Image    - tag :ollama</br>
Standard Image  - tag :main</br>
Cuda Image      - tag :cuda

enum.description: Ollama Image (Includes Ollama for built-in support).
Standard Image (OpenAPI or External Ollama Server usage).

attrs.label: Ollama Base URL (Optional, Used for External Ollama Server)
attrs.description: The base URL for Ollama server

attrs.label: OpenAI API Key (Optional, For OpenAI API)
attrs.description: The OpenAI API key

attrs.label: User ID
attrs.description: The user id that Open WebUI files will be owned by.

attrs.label: Group ID
attrs.description: The group id that Open WebUI files will be owned by.

attrs.label: Port Bind Mode
attrs.description:
The port bind mode.</br>
- Publish: The port will be published on the host for external access.</br>
- Expose: The port will be exposed for inter-container communication.</br>
- None: The port will not be exposed or published.</br>
Note: If the Dockerfile defines an EXPOSE directive,
the port will still be exposed for inter-container communication regardless of this setting.

enum.description: Publish port on the host for external access

attrs.label: Host IPs
attrs.description: IPs on the host to bind this port

attrs.label: Open WebUI Data Storage
attrs.description: The path to store Open WebUI Data.

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)

attrs.label: ixVolume Configuration
attrs.description: The configuration for the ixVolume dataset.

attrs.label: Enable ACL
attrs.description: Enable ACL for the storage.

attrs.label: Dataset Name
attrs.description: The name of the dataset to use for storage.

attrs.label: Enable ACL
attrs.description: Enable ACL for the storage.

attrs.label: Host Path
attrs.description: The host path to use for storage.

attrs.description: The path to store Open WebUI Ollama.

ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.</br>
SMB Share: Is a SMB share that is mounted to as a volume.</br>
NFS Share: Is a NFS share that is mounted to as a volume.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)
SMB/CIFS Share (Mounts a volume to a SMB share)
NFS Share (Mounts a volume to a NFS share)

attrs.description: Mount the volume as read only.

attrs.description: The path inside the container to mount the storage.

1.1.44.readme:
Open WebUI

Open WebUI - User-friendly AI Interface (Supports Ollama, OpenAI API, ...)

Open WebUI is an extensible, feature-rich, and user-friendly self-hosted WebUI designed to operate entirely offline. It supports various LLM runners, including Ollama and OpenAI-compatible APIs.

chart_metadata.description: Open WebUI is an extensible, feature-rich, and user-friendly self-hosted WebUI designed to operate entirely offline. It supports various LLM runners, including Ollama and OpenAI-compatible APIs.
chart_metadata.name: open-webui

run_as_context.description: Open WebUI runs as root user.
Redis runs as any non-root user.

chart_metadata.title: Open WebUI
